intro: Dichromena amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian dichromena, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its strikingly colored flowers, which often display contrasting hues of red and yellow. It typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in the dense canopy of the rainforest. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
